p: Studies by Ahn and Lim ( 21) analyzed occupational disease in farmers according to the workers' compensation database. In the 8 yr from January 1998 to December 2005, 10,734 cases of compensated occupational diseases in agricultural, forestry, and fishery workers were collected from 608,449 workers. There were 131 cases of occupational infection, including 24 cases in agricultural workers and 107 cases in fishery workers. The most common cause of infection (123 cases) was rickettsial disease known as scrub typhus (tsutsugamushi disease) ( 22). The majority of data was from workers below 6 months after employment and those over 50 yr old.
